subject: Re: [junit] how to run junit test with an object dependency which returns multiple values
msgSnippet: ... I don t understand the question. Could you give us an example of what you re trying to do? -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info Your guide
messageBody:
joeytran2002 wrote:
>
>
> Hi Guru,
> Suppose I have these classes
> interface A{
> double getSalary(Employee a);
> }
>
> class B{
> private A a;
> public void setA(A _a){
> this.a = _a;
> }
> public getTotalSalary(List<Employee> lstEmployee){
> double totalSalary = 0;
> for(int i =0; i< lstEmployee.size(); i++)
> totlaSalary =+ a.getSalary(lstEmployee.get(i);
>
> return salary;
> }
> }
>
> How do I set up interface A in class B, so that a will return
> different value for each Employee in the Employee list

I don't understand the question. Could you give us an example of what
you're trying to do?
